required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Using Intravitreal Injections of a Small Interfering RNA in Patients With Age-Related Macular Degeneration

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 24-month study to evaluate multiple doses of AGN211745 (previously known as Sirna-027) in treatment of subfoveal choroidal neovascularization associated with age-related macular degeneration

clinical_study.why_stopped: The study was terminated early due to company decision (non-safety related).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) of 15 or More Letters at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with improvement in BCVA of 15 or more letters at Month 3. BCVA is measured using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly (ranging from 0 to 100 letters). The lower the number of letters read correctly on the eye chart, the worse the vision (or visual acuity). An increase in the number of letters read correctly means that vision has improved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lesion Size as Assessed by Fluorescein Angiography (FA) and Photography at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Lesion size as assessed by FA and photography at month 3. FA is a technique for examining the circulation of the retina (and detecting any leakage) using a dye-tracing method. Photographs are taken with a specialized low-power microscope with an attached camera designed to photograph the interior of the eye, including the retina and optic disc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Foveal Thickness as Assessed by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Foveal thickness as assessed by OCT at month 3. The fovea is a part of the eye, located in the center of the macula region of the retina. OCT is a laser-based, noninvasive, diagnostic system providing high-resolution, three-dimensional images of the retina. The fovea is responsible for sharp central vision, which is necessary for reading or any activity where visual detail is of primary importance. Normal foveal thickness ranges from 175 to 250 microns. A foveal thickness greater than 250 microns represents worsening vision.

Visual Functioning Questionnaire (VFQ) at Month 3. The VFQ includes 25 questions which assess visual impairment on functioning and specific aspects of health-related quality of life. Study terminated; data for this outcome measure were not analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Treatment With Standard of Care at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Time to treatment with standard-of-care at month 6, defined as the number of days before the use of rescue therapy occurred.

intervention.description: AGN 211745 Solution 1000µg injection at Day 1, Month 1, Month 2
AGN 211745 Solution 300µg injections, Day 1, Month 1, Month 2
AGN 211745 Solution 100µg injections, Day 1, Month 1, Month 2
Ranibizumab 500µg injections at Day 1, Month 1, Month 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 50 years or older with "wet" AMD as determined by an ophthalmologist
- decrease in visual acuity (20/40 to 20/640) in at least one eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled systemic disease
- History of heart attack or stroke within one year of study entry
- Symptomatic coronary artery disease
- Cataracts that interfere with vision

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) of 15 or More Letters at Month 3
outcome.description: Percentage of patients with improvement in BCVA of 15 or more letters at Month 3. BCVA is measured using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly (ranging from 0 to 100 letters). The lower the number of letters read correctly on the eye chart, the worse the vision (or visual acuity). An increase in the number of letters read correctly means that vision has improved.
outcome.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT). The ITT population included all patients who started the study (randomized).

outcome.title: Foveal Thickness as Assessed by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) at Month 3
outcome.description: Foveal thickness as assessed by OCT at month 3. The fovea is a part of the eye, located in the center of the macula region of the retina. OCT is a laser-based, noninvasive, diagnostic system providing high-resolution, three-dimensional images of the retina. The fovea is responsible for sharp central vision, which is necessary for reading or any activity where visual detail is of primary importance. Normal foveal thickness ranges from 175 to 250 microns. A foveal thickness greater than 250 microns represents worsening vision.
outcome.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT). The ITT population included all patients who started the study (randomized).

measure.description: Foveal thickness as assessed by OCT at month 3. The fovea is a part of the eye, located in the center of the macula region of the retina. OCT is a laser-based, noninvasive, diagnostic system providing high-resolution, three-dimensional images of the retina. The fovea is responsible for sharp central vision, which is necessary for reading or any activity where visual detail is of primary importance. Normal foveal thickness ranges from 175 to 250 microns. A foveal thickness greater than 250 microns represents worsening vision.
measure.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT). The ITT population included all patients who started the study (randomized).

outcome.title: Visual Functioning Questionnaire (VFQ) at Month 3
outcome.description: Visual Functioning Questionnaire (VFQ) at Month 3. The VFQ includes 25 questions which assess visual impairment on functioning and specific aspects of health-related quality of life. Study terminated; data for this outcome measure were not analyzed.
outcome.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT). The ITT population included all patients who started the study (randomized). Data for this outcome measure were not analyzed as the study was terminated early.

measure.title: Visual Functioning Questionnaire (VFQ) at Month 3
measure.description: Visual Functioning Questionnaire (VFQ) at Month 3. The VFQ includes 25 questions which assess visual impairment on functioning and specific aspects of health-related quality of life. Study terminated; data for this outcome measure were not analyzed.
measure.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT). The ITT population included all patients who started the study (randomized). Data for this outcome measure were not analyzed as the study was terminated early.

outcome.title: Time to Treatment With Standard of Care at Month 6
outcome.description: Time to treatment with standard-of-care at month 6, defined as the number of days before the use of rescue therapy occurred.
outcome.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT). The ITT population included all patients who started the study (randomized).

measure.title: Time to Treatment With Standard of Care at Month 6
measure.description: Time to treatment with standard-of-care at month 6, defined as the number of days before the use of rescue therapy occurred.
measure.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT). The ITT population included all patients who started the study (randomized).

reported_events.desc: The safety population was used to calculate the number of participants at risk for SAEs and AEs and is the total number of patients that were randomized AND treated.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was terminated early due to a company decision (non-safety related). Because the study was terminated early, data for certain outcome measures (ie, "Visual Functioning Questionnaire [VFQ] at Month 3") were not analyzed.
